entry.title: Can't drop your Heroku database?
entry.content:
If you're trying to drop your database on Heroku, and it's not working, be sure you put it in maintenance mode first. i.e.

Step 1

bash $ heroku maintenance:on --app

Step 2

bash $ heroku pg:reset SHARED_DATABASE --app

Step 3

???

Step 4

Profit

entry.title: Full text search on Heroku with Texticle
entry.content:
We just spent some time investigating some alternative to full text search on Heroku. The initial solutions were either ThinkingSphinx (with a remote sphinx daemon, and another copy of the app running - yuck), or one of the paid options like WebSolr. None tickled our fancy. Free and simple tickle our fancy.

Along comes Texticle. Not sure about the name, but it simple, and works a treat.

http://tenderlovemaking.com/2009/10/17/full-text-search-on-heroku/

He's even sporting a mullet in his github avatar. Bonus points for that.

entry.title: Heroku - the 5mb free plan - is it enough?
entry.content:
Heroku just got better. 

If you like to go a little crazy vendoring gems in your Rails apps, and you like the idea of Heroku's free (5mb) plan, then you're in luck. Read on;

Begin forwarded message:

Subject:[Support] Re: Do the gems installed as part of a .gems manifest count towar... (ticket #2486)
glenn.roberts, Nov 17 12:04 am (PST):
Do the gems installed as part of a .gems manifest count toward your storage limit? E.g. would installing 5.1mb of gems push your app over the 5mb limit on the free Blossom plan ?

entry.title: Heroku - the fastest way to getting a Rails app into Production
entry.content:
Ok, unless you already have a nice Capistrano deploy script lying around and a tasty Linode/Slicehost VPS, then Heroku may just be the fastest way to get a Rails app deployed on a production system.

Its as easy as:

bash sudo gem install heroku heroku create git push heroku master heroku rake db:migrate heroku open

Sit back and watch your app open automagically in your browser.

Also note, Siyelo Fuselage has been updated to be compatible with a Heroku deployment.
